ratings.question_text: What percentage of the reading and other assignments did you complete?

narratives.question_text: How well was the course organized?
comments: I appreciated the chronological timeline that we followed. It allowed for the historical element of the course to be easily digested in relation to the content of the plays.
We moved chronologically, for the most part, which I feel worked nicely for the course.

narratives.question_text: How effective was the balance between instruction and discussion?
comments: Great discussion between Marc and those in the class.

The lectures were filled with information but we also had very fruitful and interesting discussions. It was a good mix of backgrounds in the class which allowed for a variety of perspectives and opinions.
Marc brought extremely interesting material to meetings to lecture on, but I wish there had been more class discussion throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: How well did the assigned papers, reports or other projects reflect the aims of the course?
comments: Audited course

narratives.question_text: How did the amount of assigned reading work with weekly discussion?
comments: There was a lot of reading!

It was excessive. It would perhaps be helpful to have a it denoted on the syllabus what the most important readings were for each week, and which were secondary, so that we could be sure to read the most important ones if we were unable to read it all.
It always felt like a lot of reading (plays from this time period are long!) but we almost always managed to get through all of the plays during our class discussions, so it ended up working out .
But don't squeeze four plays into one day. Even if time's run out. Sometimes something has to give.

I really appreciated anytime that there were supplementary photos or videos that we could watch during class (especially during the session on minstrelsy - getting to see a clip from Bamboozled, amongst other things, really hit home in a way that just reading the play didn't quite capture)
Marc chooses wonderfully informative supplementary readings that were usually relevant to the primary texts we read for class meetings.

narratives.question_text: The course filled a significant gap in your knowledge of the field.
comments: I knew very little on this topic before taking this course, so every class period I learned something new.
I was excited to learn so much about melodrama, minstrelsy, and temperance drama. I do wish we had gotten to vaudeville, however.

narratives.question_text: Regardless of whether or not the course is required, would you recommend it to other students in and outside the department?
comments: Yes.
Not sure. Only if they were interested in the subject matter.
Yes

I think what's cool about this course is that it digs deeply into a period of less well-known theater history. The plays we read aren't necessarily classics that are being done all over the place. Marc makes it especially interesting because he really connects what we're reading to the social and political movements/themes of the time. I think for someone who is looking to round out there knowledge of early drama in the US, this is a great course.

narratives.question_text: The course goals were clearly presented.
comments: I don't recall, but they seem implicit.

narratives.question_text: The instructor has a strong grasp of the course subject matter.
comments: Marc really knows what he is talking about. And when he doesn't, he's very straight-forward about not-knowing and then finding out.
Marc is very knowledgable of the play texts. At times, I felt that the course would have benefited from more detailed information on the political and historical context of some of the plays.

narratives.question_text: The instructor presented the subject matter effectively.
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: The instructor was willing to consider diverse points of view.
comments: Marc was always willing to consider diverse points of view in class. When he disagreed with them, he did so with great tact. It never seemed combative. He was always happy to hear students develop ideas in class.

narratives.question_text: The instructor was willing to answer pertinent questions.
comments: Marc was always willing to answer questions. At times, he could have provided richer answers about the historical and political context of the plays. Also, Marc is extremely eloquent person, who can answer difficult questions with style, but sometimes I think his answers could be more concise.

narratives.question_text: The grading criteria was clearly explained.
comments: I don't recall.

narratives.question_text: The instructor was available for consultation, discussion and advice.
comments: I really appreciated being able to meet with Marc and talking through the final paper assignment.
Marc was available for advising during office hours and was very responsive to email queries.

narratives.question_text: I would recommend this instructor to other students.
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: How many of the 14 class meetings did you attend?  Comments:
comments: All
I think nearly all of them. I maybe missed one class.
All of them.
All but one (due to a YSD/Rep assignment)

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments you have on such topics as: what worked best about the course, what improvements you would suggest, etc.
comments: See comments about the reading in the other section.
